TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FileLevelPageControlBuilder extends System.Web.UI.RootBuilder

Docs.summary: Parses page files and is the default class for parsing page files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Control builders support the page parser in building a control and the child controls that the control contains. The <xref:System.Web.UI.FileLevelPageControlBuilder> class is the default <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder> class for individual page files. Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.FileLevelPageControlBuilder> methods to provide custom page parsing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.FileLevelPageControlBuilder.%23ctor%2A> constructor is used by ASP.NET when parsing the page and is not intended for use in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void AppendLiteralString(string text) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub AppendLiteralString (text As String)

Docs.param: The content to add to the control.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified literal content to a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.FileLevelPageControlBuilder.AppendLiteralString%2A> method to add literal content to the control. Literal content can be any text that is passed by the browser to the server control. For example, any HTML elements and text, between their opening and closing tags, are literal content.

Docs.exception: The method cannot append the literal string to a content page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void AppendSubBuilder(class System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder subBuilder) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub AppendSubBuilder (subBuilder As ControlBuilder)

Docs.param: The assigned to the child control.
Docs.summary: Adds a object to the object for any child controls that belong to the container control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.FileLevelPageControlBuilder.AppendSubBuilder%2A> method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.AppendSubBuilder%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to provide custom logic when master pages and content pages are being used. In a content page, anything that is not inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> control (except script blocks for server code) raises an <xref:System.Web.HttpParseException> exception. Adding a <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder> object for a child control that is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> control raises an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception. For more information about master and content pages, see [ASP.NET Master Pages](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4e53eedf-8304-4e7a-aed1-691a2623b28b).

Docs.exception: The that was added is associated with a control and is only allowed on pages that contain controls.
The content page contained a literal other than a control.
